PracticePhrase: The pencil is under the table
TranslatedPhrase: El lápiz está debajo de la mesa

PracticePhrase: My pen is red not blue
TranslatedPhrase: Mi bolígrafo es rojo no azul

PracticePhrase: I’ll do it when I can
I’ll see him as soon as I can
Don’t you know when they’re coming?
They’ll come when I call them
When are you going to call them?
I’ll call them when I have time
Don’t you have any time now?
Then, why don’t you do it?

TranslatedPhrase: Les visitaremos mañana por la mañana

PracticePhrase: He’ll be here a bit later
TranslatedPhrase: Él estará aquí un poco más tarde

PracticePhrase: Will they ask me a lot of questions?
She’ll come when she wants to
I had no idea you were ill
TranslatedPhrase: No tenía ni idea de que estabas enferma

PracticePhrase: I learned about it through him
TranslatedPhrase: Me enteré de ello a través de él

PracticePhrase: It’s a good thing I ran into her
TranslatedPhrase: Menos mal que tropecé con ella

PracticePhrase: What did the doctors tell you?
How did that happen to you?
When will you leave the hospital?
Keep me up to date on how you’re doing
TranslatedPhrase: Mantenme al día de cómo vas

PracticePhrase: And wouldn’t you after what I’ve done?
TranslatedPhrase: ¿Y tú no lo estarías después de lo que he hecho yo?

PracticePhrase: I mean that everything up to now has been easy for me
TranslatedPhrase: Quiero decir que todo hasta ahora ha sido fácil para mí

PracticePhrase: I missed very few in the last book
TranslatedPhrase: Fallé muy pocos en el último libro
